New Records: Nikola Jokić and Russell Westbrook became the first pair of teammates to record triple-doubles in the same game multiple times in the same season.
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokić had 35 points, 15 assists, and 12 rebounds, while Russell Westbrook finished with 25 points, 11 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Pre-Game Insights: There were questions during the offseason about Russell Westbrook's fit with the Nuggets.
Post-Match Reflections: The Nuggets have climbed up to fourth in the Western Conference standings with a 22-15 record.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets are within three games of the Houston Rockets for the No. 2 seed.
Others: Aaron Gordon's injury led to Michael Malone moving Russell Westbrook into the starting lineup on Dec. 27.
New Player Records: Nikola Jokić remains an unstoppable machine with 15 triple-doubles in 32 starts.
New Team Records: The Nuggets are 7-2 in nine games since Russell Westbrook joined the starting five.
Milestones or Significant Achievements: Jokić is right on the edge of averaging a triple-double for the season with 31.6 points, 13.0 rebounds, and 9.9 assists per game.
Player Performance: Russell Westbrook is averaging 15.4 points on 53.5 percent shooting, 8.2 assists, and 7.4 rebounds.
Team Performance: The Nuggets have won six of their last eight games.
Upcoming Match: The Nuggets will face the Dallas Mavericks on January 11, 2025.
Head-to-Head Statistics: The Nuggets are 7-2 in nine games since Russell Westbrook joined the starting five.
Unique Historical Aspects: Nikola Jokić and Russell Westbrook became the first pair of teammates to record triple-doubles in the same game multiple times in the same season.
Pre-Game Expectations: Experts favored the Nuggets to win based on their recent performance.
Game Betting: 74% of bets are on the Nuggets to win, while 26% are on the Mavericks.
